column2: NEBRASKA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Nebraska
column6: NE

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is traveling in the area where you are driving, you must:
column4: proceed slowly and let the vehicle pass.
column6: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column8: keep driving in your lane.
column10: stop immediately and let the vehicle pass.

column2: 2. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column6: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column8: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 3. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column10: need to brake suddenly.

column2: 4. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull the steering wheel back.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 5. This warning sign:
column4: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 6. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and look for a flagger.
column6: stay alert, slow down and be prepared to stop.
column8: alert drivers as they approach and enter the work zone.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Be prepared to stop if necessary
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column8: Stop and yield to pedestrians and cross traffic

column2: 8. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column6: must enter the roadway immediately.
column8: has the right-of-way.
column10: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 9. When approach a stopped emergency vehicle with flashing lights on a multi-lane controlled access highway, drivers must:
column4: move into a lane at least one lane away from stopped vehicles, if possible.
column6: continue at the same speed.
column8: immediately come to a complete stop.
column10: pull off the road and stop.

column2: 10. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: No, never.
column6: Yes, always.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column10: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 11. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column4: at intersections.
column6: on narrow roads.
column8: when the road is wet.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 12. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column6: Apply the parking brake slowly.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 13. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: increase your speed and move to the left.
column10: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 14. When you are approaching a railroad crossing with no signal lights or crossing gates, you should:
column4: come to a complete stop.
column6: look both ways, listen for and yield to trains and be prepared to stop if a train is approaching.
column8: proceed at a constant speed while looking and listening for trains.

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a side road.
column6: a sharp turn.
column8: a cross road.
column10: a winding road.

column2: 16. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column6: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: Rounabout rules apply.
column10: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 17. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column10: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.

column2: 18. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column6: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column10: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 19. This yellow sign means:
column4: Stop at the railroad tracks
column6: Merging traffic ahead
column8: Undivided highway ahead
column10: Lane ends ahead

column2: 20. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column4: sharp turn
column6: no U-turn
column8: no left turn
column10: no sharp turn

column2: 21. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes.
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column8: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column10: Only if the light is green.

column2: 22. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column8: Enter the intersection with caution.
column10: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 23. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: what is not allowed.
column6: the law.
column8: the direction they should travel.
column10: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: Parking is not allowed.
column8: No parking on pavement.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 25. This road sign is:
column4: a regulatory sign.
column6: a warning sign.
column8: a guide sign.
column10: a speed reduction sign.
